title: FAQ
content: # Frequently Asked Questions  ### How long are labs available? Each lab session lasts 8 hours from the time of provisioning.  ### Can I use my own tools? Yes — you can use any local or browser-based tools to test and analyze labs.  ### Are labs graded? Labs are self-paced. Writeups and flags are optionally reviewed if submitted.

title: Home
content: # VulnServer Labs Documentation  Welcome to the official VulnServer Labs documentation hub.  👉 Start with [Getting Started](getting-started/)   👉 Browse [User Guide](user-guide/)   👉 Explore [Lab Reference](lab-reference/)

title: README
content: # VulnServer-Labs https://vulnserver.net

title: Automation
content: # Automation  Use Burp Suite, sqlmap, and curl to automate your testing workflows and accelerate findings.

title: Browser Tools
content: # Browser Tools  Recommended browser extensions and techniques for client-side vulnerability testing.

title: Advanced Usage
content: # Advanced Usage  Take your experience further with tooling tips, automation, and collaboration workflows.

title: Team Collaboration
content: # Team Collaboration  Strategies for using VulnServer Labs in classrooms, clubs, or team training environments.

title: API Reference
content: # API Reference  Details of any RESTful endpoints or internal tools exposed by the platform.

title: Developers
content: # Developers  Documentation for contributors and integrators using APIs or infrastructure automation tools.

title: Terraform Hooks
content: # Terraform Hooks  Explore how the platform provisions lab infrastructure with Terraform, including session-based triggers.

title: Webhook Examples
content: # Webhook Examples  Use Stripe Checkout or other services to trigger lab provisioning workflows with example payloads.

title: Create Account
content: # Creating Your VulnServer Labs Account  To begin, simply enter your email on our signup form. We'll send you a secure Magic Link that logs you in automatically.

title: Getting Started
content: # Getting Started  Welcome to VulnServer Labs. This guide walks you through creating your account and launching your first lab.  ## 🔐 1. Create an Account  You’ll receive a magic link to access your dashboard. [Learn how.](create-account.md)  ## 💳 2. Purchase a Lab Session  Use Stripe checkout and pick the lab tier that fits your needs. [View plans.](purchase-labs.md)

title: Magic Links
content: # How Magic Links Work  Magic links are time-limited login URLs that provide passwordless access to your dashboard and lab sessions.

title: Purchase Labs
content: # Purchase a Lab Session  Lab sessions are available via Stripe Checkout. You can select a plan and launch your lab within minutes.

title: Create a Class
content: # Creating a Class  Learn how to enroll students, distribute lab access, and assign work using VulnServer Labs.

title: Instructors
content: # Instructors  Guidance for educators, trainers, and program leads using VulnServer Labs in a classroom or team setting.

title: LMS Integration
content: # LMS Integration  Preview of upcoming integrations with LMS platforms such as Canvas, Moodle, and Blackboard.

title: Manage Progress
content: # Managing Progress  Track student or team member progress through dashboard features and submission records.

title: Authentication Bypass
content: # Authentication Bypass  Explore vulnerabilities in login mechanisms such as weak tokens, JWT tampering, and session hijacking.

title: File Inclusion
content: # File Inclusion Attacks  Learn to exploit local and remote file inclusion, file upload flaws, and path traversal.

title: Lab Reference
content: # Lab Reference  Explore the core vulnerability themes featured in VulnServer Labs.

title: Remote Code Execution
content: # Remote Code Execution (RCE)  Dive into labs that demonstrate how chained exploits can result in RCE, from LFI to deserialization.

title: Web Vulnerabilities
content: # Web Vulnerabilities  Covers XSS, SQL Injection, CSRF, and other web-related flaws commonly found in OWASP Top 10.

title: Data Retention
content: # Data Retention  All lab data is temporary. Learn about how long sessions, flags, and writeups are stored.

title: Security
content: # Security  Understand how VulnServer Labs protects your data and lab environments.

title: Logging
content: # Logging  User actions and lab activity may be logged to support educational feedback and platform integrity.

title: Sandbox Environments
content: # Sandbox Environments  Labs run in isolated sandboxes with limited lifetimes to ensure safe experimentation.

title: User Guide
content: # User Guide  This section explains how to launch, navigate, and submit within VulnServer Labs.

title: Lab UI Overview
content: # Lab UI Overview  Each lab features a terminal, HTTP viewer, and instructions panel.

title: Launching Labs
content: # Launching Labs  From your dashboard, click “Launch” to start a new session. Labs spin up in seconds.

title: Submitting Writeups
content: # Submitting Writeups  Submit your results via the submission panel — flags, screenshots, and write-ups are all accepted.
